title: AAQ: Does Modern Science Believe in Reincarnation  |  His Grace Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa

segments.text: I believe in reincarnation. Does modern science accept it or not?
Modern science, well, it ranges from 0 to 100. There are people in science who don't believe in reincarnation.
There are people who believe somewhere in between. There are people who believe totally in reincarnation.
So we have all kinds of people. It's not that if you are a believer in science,
you cannot be a believer in God. It's not like that. Because both are different branches of knowledge.
It's like asking, does someone who believes in physics really believe in mathematics?
Or someone who believes in mathematics really believes in biology?

called material energy. This is the way the Bhagavad Gita and the Vedic scriptures approach
the world around us that there are two distinct separate energies. Both are energies. One
is material energy, another is spiritual energy. Spiritual energy is superior because it is
trying to control and manipulate the inferior material energy. Why is one called the inferior
and the other called superior? Because the superior energy has got the controlling tendency
and manipulating tendency, whereas the other energy does not have. The spiritual energy,
the superior energy has consciousness, therefore it is superior. Material energy cannot possess
consciousness at any point of time, therefore it is inferior. So this is how we have to
see distinctly, you know, any person with common sense can make out this distinction.
There is a distinct difference between a living person and dead matter. And that is why very
simple example, as long as we are alive, we look at each other and call each other by
names. We go to a hospital, they will ask for the medical record and they will say so
and so person is getting treated here and all that. And suppose a person goes to the
hospital and he dies in the hospital. What happens? The doctor will come and tell, please
take the dead body and go. They will not tell the name of the person because no more, that
person is no more, that person is gone. Only body has been left behind. Very simple, no,
what is the difference between a living person and a dead body? It is the person who is there
within the body. So it's very common sense. It doesn't require much, very great intelligence
to understand this. But unfortunately, scientists, although they are apparently very intelligent,
they are not able to see even this simple truth. That is why Krishna refers to them
in the Bhagavad Gita as mayaya apasruta jnana. Their knowledge has been snatched away by
the glamour, the glitter of material energy. They will invent one AI and they will say,
we are almost there. We are going to create sentient air. We have, we have figured out
how to create light. And they go on like this, like this. They will, you know, they will
die. Their sons will come. They will also die. Their grandchildren will come. They will
also die. Each of them will keep telling the people of their generation. We are almost
there. We have figured it out. Don't worry. And life will go on. Death will go on. Business
of science will also go on like this. So we should not get carried away by the glitter
of the material energy. That's the whole thing. If you are carried away by the glitter of
material energy, how much science and technology has had to do with it, how much science has
advanced, what all discoveries have happened.
So when you look at all those things, yes, we will be able to figure out what are the
chemicals bringing about consciousness and life. This is how maya covers the intelligence
of the living entity. This is called the avarana atmika shakti of maya. Material energy, although
it is inferior, it has the ability to blind us with her glitter, promising something in
the future. In the future, we are going to find out. In the future, we are going to
be able to create, recreate life. So these kinds of false assurances are given to us
by maya which covers our intelligence and we are unable to see the simple stark reality.
This is what the Vedic scriptures are pointing out.
